Japan's PM Takaichi: We discussed Chinese exports of rare earths.

data.title: Xifeng Liquor Co. calls for confidence in domestic baijiu brands in global market; Zhang Zhouhu encourages quality consensus.
data.description: On October 31, 2025 in Beijing, the well-established baijiu producer Shaanxi Xifeng Liquor Co., Ltd. from China emphasized the importance of cultural confidence and quality agreement for local baijiu labels as they venture into international markets. Zhang Zhouhu, the general manager of Xifeng, highlighted this during a recent announcement.

data.title: Revolutionary system SalsSky: The Chosen One redefines personal growth in a crowded self-help market.
data.description: On October 31, 2025, a revolutionary self-improvement system named SalsSky: The Chosen One was introduced in New York. Amidst the abundance of self-help resources and instant motivational solutions, this innovative program stands out by offering a unique approach to personal transformation. Unlike traditional methods, SalsSky is not just about providing quick fixes; it aims to redefine the way individuals pursue self-improvement. This elite program promises to revolutionize the industry with its distinctive strategies and tailored guidance.

data.title: Global toothpaste market shifting towards herbal products and online sales; projected to grow from $29.32B in 2025 to $32.45B by 2030 (2.05% CAGR).
data.description: In Hyderabad, India, as of October 31, 2025, a recent report from Mordor Intelligence forecasts a growth in the global toothpaste market. The market size is expected to increase from USD 29.32 billion in 2025 to USD 32.45 billion by 2030, showing a Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of 2.05%. This growth is attributed to the increasing preference for herbal, natural, and...

data.title: Uxin partners with Guangzhou authorities to build used car superstore; expands market reach.
data.description: On October 31, 2025, Uxin Limited, a prominent used car retailer in China listed on Nasdaq under the symbol UXIN, revealed a significant development. The company disclosed its collaboration with government officials in Guangzhou for a strategic initiative. This partnership involves a joint investment in constructing a project that aligns with the objectives of both parties.

data.title: Chishui River Forum in Guizhou Province focuses on global liquor industry sustainability with 400 participants.
data.description: On October 31, 2025, the 2025 Chishui River Forum took place in Guizhou Province, southwest China. Themed "Interweaving Harmony," the event drew around 400 attendees from various countries. Notable participants included representatives from leading liquor companies.

data.title: Guardian Angel Senior Services expands with 13th location in Massachusetts, aiding caregivers in Mystic Valley Elder.
data.description: Guardian Angel Senior Services, a privately owned senior home care company based in Billerica, Massachusetts, has recently launched its thirteenth branch in the state. Situated in Malden, this new office aims to offer enhanced assistance to caregivers catering to the needs of seniors in the Mystic Valley Elder community. This expansion showcases the company's commitment to providing quality care services, with a focus on supporting caregivers in delivering exceptional care to senior residents.

data.title: Harvard Professor Naomi Oreskes awarded 2025 Volvo Environment Prize for pioneering work in environmental science.
data.description: Renowned earth scientist and historian, Naomi Oreskes from Harvard University, has been awarded the prestigious 2025 Volvo Environment Prize by the Volvo Environment Prize Foundation in Gothenburg, Sweden. Oreskes is recognized for her significant contributions in the field.

data.title: Chinese business leaders discuss cultural inheritance and innovation, emphasizing joint efforts to promote traditional Chinese culture.
data.description: In Beijing on October 31, 2025, a detailed discussion took place between the board chairpersons of Zhangzhou Pien Tze Huang Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd. (Pien Tze Huang) and Kweichow Moutai Group. The focus was on collaborating to advance the preservation and modernization of traditional Chinese culture. This meeting emphasized the importance of cultural heritage with both companies aiming to combine their expertise and resources.
NVIDIA CEO Huang: Hopeful both governments will arrive at a conclusion, I have no news today on china sales.

data.title: Pony.ai receives Shenzhen's first citywide permit for fully driverless commercial robotaxi ops, a major milestone.
data.description: In Shenzhen, China, on October 31, 2025, Pony.ai, a prominent player in autonomous mobility, revealed that they received Shenzhen's initial citywide license for operating fully driverless commercial robotaxis. This groundbreaking development sets the stage for widespread deployment.

data.title: Binance teams up with Bubblemaps to improve Web3 Wallet with advanced on-chain analytics for visual insights on tokens. (Characters: 112)
data.description: Binance has collaborated with Bubblemaps to upgrade its Web3 Wallet by incorporating advanced on-chain analytics. This partnership will provide users with visual data demonstrating token distribution and transaction history. The move aims to enhance user experience and offer a more transparent view of the blockchain ecosystem.

data.title: Grand Prix ACF AutoTech 2026 applications now open with €2.5 billion managed, 9 partner funds, and new Industrialization Award.
data.description: In Paris, AVP Capital, a global investment fund overseeing more than €2.5 billion, has joined a collaborative effort involving eight established partner funds. BPI France / La French Fab has also come on board as a partner. Together with the French Automotive Platform (PFA), a new Industrialization Award will be introduced to honor a past finalist from 2018. The Automobile Club de France and the Automobile & Mobility Club of ESSEC Alumni have jointly announced the commencement of the 9th edition of the Grand Prix ACF AutoTe.
LME ALUMINIUM INVENTORY RISES 98,525 TONS TO 558,050 TONS

data.title: Magna's Q3 2025 results: Sales up 2% to $10.5B, Adjusted EBIT $613M, Diluted EPS at $1.08, Adjusted diluted EPS $1.33, positive performance boosts confidence. Strategic decisions include Increase 2025 Sales outlook, Normal Course Issuer Bid to buy 10% of Common Shares.
data.description: Magna International Inc. reported strong performance in the third quarter of 2025 compared to the same period in 2024. Sales increased by 2% to $10.5 billion, supported by a 3% rise in global light vehicle production. Income from operations before income taxes was $473 million, down 32%, and Adjusted EBIT increased by 3% to $613 million, with an improvement in the Adjusted EBIT margin. Diluted earnings per share were $1.08, while Adjusted diluted earnings per share rose by 4% to $1.33. Net income attributable to Magna International Inc. was $305 million for the quarter. The company also announced an increased outlook for sales, Adjusted EBIT margin, and Adjusted Net Income. Additionally, the board approved a Normal Course Issuer Bid to repurchase up to 10% of public float Common Shares. The company's CEO, Swamy Kotagiri, expressed confidence in the company's strategic positioning and execution amid evolving macroeconomic trends. Going forward, Magna anticipates robust free cash flow to support future growth opportunities and reinforce a disciplined approach to capital allocation.
ECB Survey: Employment outlook remains relatively subdued; wage growth moderating.
ECB Survey: longer-term inflation expectation unchanged at 2%.
